subject: Track and Field
lead_paragraph: Sanya Richards failed to make the 400-meter team for the world championships yesterday, finishing fourth in the event on a damp track at the United States track and field championships in Indianapolis. The loss broke a string of 18 outdoor victories in the 400 for Richards. Dee Dee Trotter won the 400 in a personal-best 49.64 seconds. Natasha Hastings was second in a college-record 49.84 and Mary Wineberg third at 50.24. Trotter came from third on the final turn to pull away.In the men’s 400, Angelo Taylor edged LaShawn Merritt at the finish. Taylor, the Olympic champion in the 400 hurdles, won at 44.05 to Merritt’s 44.06.
snippet: Sanya Richards failed to make the 400-meter team for the world championships yesterday, finishing fourth in the event on a damp track at the United States track and field championships in Indianapolis. The loss broke a string of 18 outdoor victories...
